alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clay; Lowndes; Montgomery; Oktibbeha; Webster (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 30 at 12:24AM CST until November 30 at 3:45AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHERN CHOCTAW, CENTRAL MONTGOMERY, WEBSTER, CLAY, NORTHEASTERN LOWNDES AND NORTHERN OKTIBBEHA COUNTIES... At 1224 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated rain continuing to move across the warning area. Up to 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen, and numerous roads are flooded. Although rainfall is diminishing now, roads may remain flooded through the night. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Starkville, Columbus, West Point, Montpelier, Columbus AFB, Eupora, Caledonia, Maben, Kilmichael, Mathiston, Cumberland, Clarkson, Pheba, Sherwood, Griffith, Bellefontaine, Pala Alto, Embry, Muldrow and Tibbee. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Choctaw; Clay; Lowndes; Montgomery; Oktibbeha; Webster
